00006 void
00007 bgp_update_send(bgp_state * state, bgp_nbr * n, bgp_route * r_send,
00008                         bgp_message * msg, int cause, tw_lp * lp)
00009 {
00010         tw_event        *e;
00011 
00012         tw_memory       *hdr;
00013         tw_memory       *b;
00014 
00015         //bgp_route     *test;
00016         bgp_message     *m;
00017 
00018         state->stats->s_nupdates_sent++;
00019         e = rn_event_new(n->id, 0.0, lp, DOWNSTREAM, BGP_UPDATE);
00020 
00021         hdr = tw_memory_alloc(lp, g_bgp_fd);
00022         m = tw_memory_data(hdr);
00023 
00024         m->b.type = UPDATE;
00025         m->b.update = msg->b.update;
00026         m->b.cause_bgp = m->b.cause_ospf = 0;
00027 
00028         if(cause)
00029                 m->b.cause_ospf = 1;
00030         else
00031         {
00032                 m->b.cause_bgp = 1;
00033                 g_bgp_stats.s_cause_bgp++;
00034         }
00035 
00036 
00037         // Having problems with membufs being attached to membufs.. impossible
00038         // to free them if the pkt is dropped outside the BGP model.
00039         tw_event_memory_set(e, hdr, g_bgp_fd);
00040         rn_event_send(e);
00041 
00042         if(e->state.owner == TW_pe_free_q || e == lp->pe->abort_event)
00043                 return;
00044 
00045         // if can be sent, get the hdr back off the event now so the route
00046         // can be put on first.
00047         e->memory = NULL;
00048 
00049         // Add the route to the UPDATE message
00050         if(msg->b.update == 0 || rn_getas(rn_getmachine(n->id)) == state->as)
00051                 b = bgp_route_copy(state, r_send, n, 0, lp);
00052         else
00053                 b = bgp_route_copy(state, r_send, n, 1, lp);
00054 
00055 #if 0
00056         test = tw_memory_data(b);
00057         if(TW_FALSE == bgp_route_equals(test, r_send))
00058                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Invalid ROUTE copy!");
00059 #endif
00060 
00061         if(m->b.update == REMOVE && state->rib[r_send->dst] == NULL)
00062                 m->b.unreachable = 1;
00063         else
00064                 m->b.unreachable = 0;
00065 
00066         tw_event_memory_set(e, b, g_bgp_fd_rtes);
00067         tw_event_memory_set(e, hdr, g_bgp_fd);
00068 
00069         // Had to be moved up to before membufs placed onto event.. because
00070         // event may be aborted, and then we do not want to copy the route
00071         //rn_event_send(e);
00072 
00073 #if VERIFY_BGP
00074         fprintf(state->log, "\t\tsent UPDATE (%d) to %d at %f: \n\t\t", 
00075                 m->b.update, n->id, tw_now(lp));
00076         bgp_route_print(state, tw_memory_data(b));
00077 #endif
00078 }
00079 
00080 void
00081 bgp_update(bgp_state * state, tw_bf * bf, bgp_message * msg, int src, tw_lp * lp)
00082 {
00083         tw_memory       *b_in;
00084         bgp_route       *r;
00085 
00086         int              cause;
00087         char             temp[2048];
00088 
00089         if(NULL == (b_in = tw_event_memory_get(lp)))
00090                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "No UPDATE on event!");
00091 
00092         r = tw_memory_data(b_in);
00093 
00094         if(!r)
00095                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Invalid route on UDPATE!");
00096 
00097         sprintf(temp, "%d %d %d", r->src, r->dst, r->next_hop);
00098 
00099         // we're adding a route
00100         if(msg->b.update)
00101         {
00102                 update_add(state, bf, b_in, msg, src, lp);
00103         } else
00104         {
00105                 update_withdraw(state, bf, r, msg, src, lp);
00106 
00107                 if(msg->b.unreachable == 0)
00108                         return;
00109 
00110 #if VERIFY_BGP
00111                 fprintf(state->log, "\tgot UNREACHABLE UPDATE from %d, for AS %d\n",
00112                         src, r->dst);
00113 #endif
00114 
00115                 if(state->rib[r->dst] != NULL)
00116                 {
00117                         msg->b.update = 1;
00118         
00119                         if(msg->b.cause_ospf)
00120                                 cause = 1;
00121                         else
00122                                 cause = 0;
00123 
00124                         bgp_update_send(state, bgp_getnbr(state, src), 
00125                                         tw_memory_data(state->rib[r->dst]), 
00126                                         msg, cause, lp);
00127                         state->stats->s_nunreachable++;
00128                 }
00129 
00130                 bgp_route_free(state, b_in, lp);
00131         }
00132 }
00133 
00134 void
00135 update_add(bgp_state * state, tw_bf * bf, tw_memory * b_in, 
00136                         bgp_message * msg, int src, tw_lp * lp)
00137 {
00138         tw_memory       *b;
00139 
00140         bgp_route       *r_in;
00141         bgp_route       *r;
00142 
00143         r_in = tw_memory_data(b_in);
00144 
00145 #if VERIFY_BGP
00146         fprintf(state->log, "\tupdate add from %d: AS %d, ", src, r_in->dst);
00147         bgp_route_aspath_print(state, r_in);
00148 #endif
00149 
00150         if(!r_in)
00151                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "No Route on UPDATE!");
00152 
00153         // check to make sure this route is not to our AS
00154         if(r_in->dst == state->as->id || bgp_route_inpath(state, r_in, lp))
00155         {
00156                 bgp_route_free(state, b_in, lp);
00157                 return;
00158         }
00159 
00160         // If cannot get to route next_hop, do not add!
00161         if(state->as == rn_getas(rn_getmachine(src)) &&
00162            NULL == rn_getlink(state->m, r_in->next_hop) &&
00163            -1 == rn_route(state->m, r_in->next_hop))
00164         {
00165                 bgp_route_free(state, b_in, lp);
00166                 return;
00167         }
00168 
00169         /*
00170          * If I already have a route to this destination, I need to decide
00171          * whether to keep the current route, or swap it with the new one!
00172          */
00173         r = NULL;
00174         if(NULL != (b = bgp_getroute(state, r_in)))
00175         {
00176                 r = tw_memory_data(b);
00177                 bf->c4 = 1;
00178 
00179                 // bgp_decision returns TW_TRUE if I should keep existing route
00180                 if ((bf->c3 = !bgp_decision(state, r_in, r, lp)))
00181                 {
00182 #if VERIFY_BGP
00183                         fprintf(state->log, "\tDecision is to not add route! \n");
00184 #endif
00185                         bgp_route_free(state, b_in, lp);
00186                         return;
00187                 } else
00188                 {
00189                         // if this is an UPDATE from an iBGP rtr, and 
00190                         // we are not the originator, then we cannot
00191                         // remove it!  We are the originator if our
00192                         // id is > the route->src
00193                         if(rn_getas(rn_getmachine(src)) == state->as &&
00194                            lp->id < r->src)
00195                         {
00196                                 bgp_route_free(state, b_in, lp);
00197                                 return;
00198                         }
00199 
00200 #if 0
00201                         // Supposed to IMPLICITLY remove these routes..
00202                         // meaning, let the UPDATE add msg handle removing
00203                         // these routes elsewhere in the network
00204                         msg->b.update = 0;
00205                         bgp_update_all(state, msg, src, r, lp);
00206                         msg->b.update = 1;
00207 #endif
00208                         // if it was an iBGP message, don't add it to OSPF
00209                         if(state->as != rn_getas(rn_getmachine(src)))
00210                                 bgp_ospf_update(state, &g_rn_as[r_in->dst], 
00211                                                 r_in, TW_FALSE, lp);
00212 
00213                         bgp_route_withdraw(state, r);
00214                         bgp_route_free(state, b, lp);
00215                 }
00216         }
00217 
00218         bgp_route_add(state, b_in);
00219 
00220         // if it was an iBGP message, don't add it to OSPF
00221         if(state->as != rn_getas(rn_getmachine(src)))
00222                 bgp_ospf_update(state, &g_rn_as[r_in->dst], r_in, TW_TRUE, lp);
00223 
00224         // Delayed now until MRAI timer fires.
00225         //bgp_update_all(state, msg, src, r_in, lp);
00226 }
00227 
00228 void
00229 update_withdraw(bgp_state * state, tw_bf * bf, bgp_route * r_in, 
00230                                 bgp_message * msg, int src, tw_lp * lp)
00231 {
00232         tw_memory       *b;
00233         bgp_route       *r;
00234 
00235         if(NULL == (b = bgp_getroute(state, r_in)))
00236                 return;
00237 
00238         r = tw_memory_data(b);
00239 
00240 #if VERIFY_BGP
00241         fprintf(state->log, "\tupdate withdraw route: \n\t");
00242         bgp_route_print(state, r_in);
00243 #endif
00244 
00245         if ((bf->c5 = (TW_TRUE == bgp_route_equals(r_in, r))))
00246         {
00247                 bgp_route_withdraw(state, r);
00248 
00249                 // if it was an iBGP message, don't add it to ospf
00250                 if(state->as != rn_getas(rn_getmachine(src)))
00251                         bgp_ospf_update(state, &g_rn_as[r_in->dst], r_in, 
00252                                         TW_FALSE, lp);
00253 
00254                 // Do not delay withdraws until MRAI timer fires!
00255                 bgp_update_all(state, msg, src, r_in, lp);
00256 
00257                 // Free the route memory buffers
00258                 bgp_route_free(state, b, lp);
00259         }
00260 }
00261 
00262 // Just a helper function to "flood" update to further nodes..
00263 void
00264 bgp_update_all(bgp_state * state, bgp_message * msg, int src, 
00265                                         bgp_route * r, tw_lp * lp)
00266 {
00267         bgp_nbr         *n;
00268         int              i;
00269 
00270         for(i = 0, n = state->nbr; i < state->n_interfaces; n = &state->nbr[++i])
00271         {
00272                 if (n->up == TW_FALSE || (src == n->id))
00273                         continue;
00274 
00275                 if(r->dst == rn_getas(rn_getmachine(n->id))->id)
00276                         continue;
00277 
00278                 // If from iBGP peer, do not send to other iBGP peers
00279                 if(state->as == rn_getas(rn_getmachine(r->src)) &&
00280                    state->as == rn_getas(rn_getmachine(n->id)))
00281                         continue;
00282 
00283                 if(msg->b.cause_bgp == msg->b.cause_ospf)
00284                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Unmarked UPDATE!");
00285 
00286                 if(msg->b.cause_bgp)
00287                         bgp_update_send(state, n, r, msg, 0, lp);
00288                 else
00289                         bgp_update_send(state, n, r, msg, 1, lp);
00290 
00291                 //msg->b.rev_num_neighbors++;
00292         }
00293 }
